question: 1 (b)
statement_html:
A biased coin with \(\displaystyle P(H) = 1/10\) is tossed 4 times. What is the probability of getting at least one H?

i. \(\displaystyle 1 - (9/10)^{4}\)

ii. \(\displaystyle (1/10)^{4}\)

iii. \(\displaystyle (1/10)(9/10)^{3}\)

iv. \(\displaystyle 1 - (1/10)^{4}\)

v. \(\displaystyle (9/10)^{4}\)
statement_latex:
A biased coin with $\displaystyle P(H) = 1/10$ is tossed 4 times. What
is the probability of getting at least one H?

i. $\displaystyle 1 - (9/10)^{4}$

ii. $\displaystyle (1/10)^{4}$

iii. $\displaystyle (1/10)(9/10)^{3}$

iv. $\displaystyle 1 - (1/10)^{4}$

v. $\displaystyle (9/10)^{4}$
statement_raw:
A biased coin with <math> \displaystyle P(H) = 1/10 </math> is tossed 4 times. What is the probability of getting at least one H?

i. <math> \displaystyle 1 - (9/10)^{4} </math>

ii. <math> \displaystyle (1/10)^{4} </math>

iii. <math> \displaystyle (1/10)(9/10)^{3} </math>

iv. <math> \displaystyle 1 - (1/10)^{4} </math>

v. <math> \displaystyle (9/10)^{4} </math>
